page.title: 08Foxhole Mine
page.content: Throughout its history, until the present day, Dartmoor has been mined for tin. In fact tin streaming leading to the silting of the{River {Plym}was the cause of the decline of one of the{Stannary towns Plympton. {Foxhole Mine}lies just to the East of{Brat Tor,}and is well preserved example of a Dartmoor mine. The tinners hut to be found here is a Hilton amoung tinners huts, consisting as it does of two rooms. It is also in a good state of repair, unlike most of the huts on the moor. The wheel pit, and the buddles are apparent, and a granite tramway can be discerned. The leat used to obtain the water for the mine can be seen as it drains down towards Doe Tor Brook. The extensive workings are amazing, considering they were all dug by hand.
